title: Robinhood’s gamification makes trading fun and exciting — what could possibly go wrong?
content:
Wall Street has long been likened to a casino. Robinhood, an investment app that just filed plans for an initial public offering, makes the comparison more apt than ever. That’s because the power of the casino is the way it makes people feel like gambling their money away is a game. Casinos are full of mood lighting, fun noises, and other sensory details that reward gamblers when they place coins in slots. Similarly, Robinhood’s slick and easy-to-use app resembles a thrill-inducing video game rather than a sober investment tool. The color palette of red and green is associated with mood,…

description: Gamification can lead people to forget the real-world consequences of their decisions — and trading apps like Robinhood make use of that.
